title: 103_hr433
content: The Act may be cited as the "Big Thicket National Preserve Addition Act of 1993" and includes additions to the Big Thicket National Preserve. The "Big Thicket National Preserve Addition Act of 1993" amends subsection (b) of the Act to update the map of the preserve, which will be available for public inspection. The Secretary of the Interior can make minor revisions to the boundaries of the preserve as needed by publishing a revised description in the Federal Register. This includes adjustments to the Little Pine Island-Pine Island Bayou corridor unit and the Lance Rosier unit. Additionally, the Village Creek Corridor unit in Hardin County, Texas, comprising approximately 5,309 acres, is added to the preserve. The Secretary is authorized to acquire lands within the boundaries of the preserve by donation, purchase, transfer from other Federal agencies, or exchange. The Secretary may acquire scenic easements on privately owned undeveloped lands within specified units with owner consent. Lands owned by commercial timber companies can only be acquired by donation or exchange. Lands owned by the State of Texas can only be acquired by donation. Within 60 days, the Secretary and Secretary of Agriculture must identify lands near the preserve. The Secretary of Agriculture may exchange national forest lands near private lands owned by timber companies in Sabine National Forest, Davy Crockett National Forest, or other agreed sites. The exchange will be conducted using available authorities and procedures, with values of properties to be determined. The Secretary of Agriculture may exchange national forest lands near private lands owned by timber companies in Sabine National Forest, Davy Crockett National Forest, or other agreed sites. The values of the properties exchanged should be approximately equal or equalized by cash payment. The exchanges must be completed within two years. Additionally, the Secretary cannot acquire a 37-acre area owned by Louisiana-Pacific Corporation or its subsidiary without consent as long as it is used exclusively as a youth camp. The Secretary must publish a detailed boundary description in the Federal Register within six months. The Secretary of Agriculture will exchange national forest lands near private lands owned by timber companies in Sabine National Forest, Davy Crockett National Forest, or other agreed sites. The values of the properties exchanged should be approximately equal or equalized by cash payment. The exchanges must be completed within two years. Additionally, the Secretary cannot acquire a 37-acre area owned by Louisiana-Pacific Corporation or its subsidiary without consent as long as it is used exclusively as a youth camp. The Secretary must publish a detailed boundary description in the Federal Register within six months. Furthermore, there is authorization of appropriations for the purposes of subsections 1(c) and 1(d) of the Act.
